text: Agnes Maryna Samaria (born 11 August 1972 in OtjiwarongoSports-Reference profile) is a retired Namibian middle distance runner who specialized in the 800 metres. Samaria won two of the three medals that the country won at the 2007 All-Africa Games. She has been a UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador since 2005. ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1995 |rowspan=2|Universiade |rowspan=2|Fukuoka, Japan |25th (h) |400 m |57.63 |- |25th (h) |800 m |2:11.61 |- |1999 |All-Africa Games |Johannesburg, South Africa |17th (h) |800 m |2:11.58 |- |2001 |World Championships |Edmonton, Canada |16th (h) |800 m |2:03.11 |- |rowspan=2|2002 |Commonwealth Games |Manchester, United Kingdom |bgcolor=cc9966 | 3rd |800 m |1:59.15 (NR) |- |African Championships |Radès, Tunisia |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |800 m |2:03.63 |- |rowspan=2|2003 |World Indoor Championships |Birmingham, United Kingdom |7th (sf) |800 m |2:01.29 |- |World Championships |Paris, France |23rd (sf) |800 m |2:02.66 |- |rowspan=2|2004 |World Indoor Championships |Budapest, Hungary |16th (h) |800 m |2:05.05 |- |Olympic Games |Athens, Greece |8th (sf) |800 m |1:59.37 |- |2005 |World Championships |Helsinki, Finland |9th (sf) |800 m |2:00.13 |- |2006 |African Championships |Bambous, Mauritius |6th |800 m |2:07.65 |- |rowspan=5|2007 |rowspan=2|World Championships |rowspan=2|Osaka, Japan |22nd (sf) |800 m |2:02.25 |- |6th |1500 m |4:07.61 (NR) |- |rowspan=2|All-Africa Games |rowspan=2|Algiers, Algeria |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |800 m |2:03.17 |- |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |1500 m |4:09.18 |- |World Athletics Final |Stuttgart, Germany |5th |1500 m |4:05.44 (NR) |- |rowspan=5|2008 |World Indoor Championships |Valencia, Spain |14th (h) |800 m |2:05.23 |- |rowspan=2|African Championships |rowspan=2|Addis Ababa, Ethiopia |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |800 m |2:00.62 |- |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |1500 m |4:13.91 |- |rowspan=2|Olympic Games |rowspan=2|Beijing, China |26th (h) |800 m |2:02.18 |- |27th (h) |1500 m |4:15.80 |} ===Personal bests=== *400 metres - 53.83 s (2001) *800 metres - 1:59.15 min (2002) *1500 metres - 4:05.30 min (2008) *Mile run - 4:25.01 min (2007) Namibian Sports Women of the Year (2002, 2003, 2004, 2005, 2006, 2007) ==References== == External links == * * Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Namibian female middle- distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2004 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2008 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Namibia Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2002 Commonwealth Games Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for Namibia Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in athletics Category:World Athletics Championships athletes for Namibia Category:People from Otjiwarongo Category:UNICEF Goodwill Ambassadors Category:African Games silver medalists for Namibia Category:African Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:African Games bronze medalists for Namibia Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1999 All-Africa Games Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2007 All-Africa Games
title: Agnes Samaria
